Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.prog

Interface ProgressionCost

All Known Implementing Classes:
GraphHeuristic, GraphHeuristic.MaxGraphHeuristic, GraphHeuristic.SumGraphHeuristic, ReachabilityHeuristic, RelaxedPlanHeuristic, RepeatedNodeHeuristic, RepeatedRootHeuristic, WeightedCost
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface ProgressionCost
A function used to measure the cost of a search node during a progression search. The progression node includes a reference to the node in the search space as well as contextual information specific to the search, such as its temporal and epistemic depth. A cost function can be used both as the cost and heuristic in a progression search, though not all cost functions will make sense in both roles.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final ProgressionCost
    PLAN_SIZE
    A cost function that returns the temporal depth of the node it is evaluation, which is equal to the number of actions that have been taken since the root state of the search.
    static final ProgressionCost
    TEMPORAL
    A cost function that returns the sum of a node's temporal offset and temporal depth, which represent the number of actions that have been taken since the root state as well as the starting temporal depth of the root state.
    static final ProgressionCost
    ZERO
    A cost function that always returns 0.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <N> double
    evaluate(ProgressionNode<N> node)
    Returns the cost of a given node based on its context in the progression search that generated it.
    default <N> void
    initialize(ProgressionNode<N> root)
    This method is called once each time a progression heuristic search is initialized with a new start state; it is used to initialize or reset this cost function before it is used for a search.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      default <N> void initialize(ProgressionNode<N> root)
      This method is called once each time a progression heuristic search is initialized with a new start state; it is used to initialize or reset this cost function before it is used for a search.
      Type Parameters:
      N - the type of object used to represent a node in the search's search space
      Parameters:
      root - the author's root (epistemic depth 0, temporal depth 0) that is the starting point of a progression search

    • evaluate

      <N> double evaluate(ProgressionNode<N> node)
      Returns the cost of a given node based on its context in the progression search that generated it.
      Type Parameters:
      N - the type of object used to represent a node in the search's search space
      Parameters:
      node - the search node whose cost should be evaluated
      Returns:
      the cost of the node
